item.title: Hell set to music
item.dc:creator: James Fenton
item.description: I mentioned in a recent column Eric Griffiths' recommendation of an "incomparable" essay by Osip Mandelstam, "Conversation on Dante," which I was resolved soon to read.

item.title: Nature Boy
item.dc:creator: James Fenton
item.description: The ideal, for literary biography, is that the author should be able to address two audiences at once: the academic and the nonspecialist.

item.title: A voice of his own
item.dc:creator: James Fenton
item.description: 'Poetry makes nothing happen', wrote WH Auden. He was a reluctant leader of his generation and adopted a deliberately anti-poetic voice.

item.title: Vina Divina
item.dc:creator: James Fenton
item.description: After her death in a Mexican earthquake, the aging pop singer Vina Apsara becomes a cult figure.

item.title: A poke in the eye with a poem
item.dc:creator: James Fenton
item.description: Of the leading Ulster poets - Seamus Heaney, Michael Longley, Paul Muldoon - Longley is the only one still resident in Ulster.
